response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for (Iterator<Map.Entry<String, Integer>> it = map.entrySet().iterator(); it.hasNext(); ) {
int maxValue = Collections.max(map.values());
int count = 20;
while (count > 0) {
if (map.get(it.next().getKey()) == maxValue) {
System.out.println(it.next().getKey() + "occurs" + maxValue + "times");
count--;
}
maxValue--;
}
}
<<<explanation>>>: This code iterates through the entries of the map, finds the maximum value, and compares it to the current value in each entry. If the current value is equal to the maximum value, it prints the key of the entry. This process continues until the count is reduced to 20. The time complexity of this code is O(n), where n is the number of entries in the map.
